definition:
The phrase “Galois is not transitive” is a mnemonic for the statement
“The relation ‘is a Galois extension of’ is not transitive.” This means
that, if $K/F$ and $L/K$ are , it does not follow that $L/F$ is Galois.
This follows immediately from the fact that normal is not transitive.
See example of normal extension for more details.
